The Cafeteria Manager and her staff helped explain that they were very sweet and not hot at all.

They encouraged all the students to try them.

Kindergarten Registration Update



We are moving forward with Kindergarten Registration by collecting the necessary paperwork from you, that the school district needs to register your child/children for Kindergarten.



If you need a packet, there are packets available to print off on the Troy Area School District website at https://www.troyareasd.org/CentralRegistration.aspx .



To have a packet mailed home or to pick a packet up at the school, contact the school at (570)297-3145.



The completed packets can be mailed to the school or dropped off on Mondays and Wednesdays from 8:30 AM to 12:30 PM.



There will be a bin near the main entrance for you to place your packet in.



Please return your completed packet by Friday, May 22nd.



As we move forward, we will get you updated information on when we will be able to meet you and your child/children in person.



We greatly look forward to that time!



If you have any questions, please do not hesitate to contact us at the above number.

Lucy Chamberlain is with Bobbie Berger and 30 others.
April 28 at 11:01 PM ¬∑

From our Croman family to each and every one of you! #OneTeamTroy

UNITY
I dreamed I stood in a studio
And watched two sculptors there,
The clay they used was a young child's mind
And they finished it with care.

One was a teacher; the tools he used
Were books and music and art;
One a parent with a guiding hand
And a gentle and loving heart.

Day after day the teacher toiled
With a touch that was deft and sure
While the parent laboured by his side
And polished and smoothed it o'er.

And when at last their task was done
They were proud of what they had wrought,
For the things they had moulded into the child
Could neither be sold nor bought

And each agreed he would have failed
If he had worked alone.
For behind the parent stood the school
And behind the teacher, the home.

Anon. * 1998

The district has completed an investigation of the student threat on 3/9/2020. The situation has been addressed appropriately by the district and law enforcement.

Although we do not discuss specific student discipline publicly, it is important to address the public with what the district is doing to mitigate theses types of threats.

The district is implementing student social-emotional health at the high school with a character building program, creation of an emotional support learning space, and providing staff training on positive behavior supports.

When students are identified who have made threats they will be removed from the school environment and law enforcement will be involved.

We encourage parents to keep open lines of communication with their children, and to promote open lines of communication with school staff and administration.

PMEA Region 4 Chorus Recap

On February 26, Trojan musicians Anna Lewis, Rylee Weaver, and Madeline Getola travelled to Greater Nanticoke HS for the PMEA Region 4 Chorus Festival.

There they rehearsed with a total of 160 of the best high school choral musicians in the region and performed an exceptional concert on Friday night of very challenging music.

Each of these singers was required to complete a 90 second audition upon arrival at the festival to determine who would be moving on to the State level.

Only the top 4 singers on each voice part qualify to move on to participate in the PMEA All-State Choir.

I am proud to report that all three of our singers placed well and Madeline Getola placed 4th in Alto 1 and WILL BE PERFORMING AS A MEMBER OF THE ALL-STATE CHOIR in the Poconos at the end of April!!

Please congratulate all of these singers on a job well done and for being such fine representatives of Troy!

Thank you!

Mrs. Sydney MacDonald

7-12 Choral Music Teacher ~ Director of Theater Arts

Troy Area Jr./Sr. High School

Apple Teacher

On February 26, Trojan musicians Anna Lewis, Rylee Weaver, and Madeline Getola travelled to Greater Nanticoke HS for the PMEA Region 4 Chorus Festival.

There they rehearsed with a total of 160 of the best high school choral musicians in the region and performed an exceptional concert on Friday night of very challenging music.

Each of these singers was required to complete a 90 second audition upon arrival at the festival to determine who would be moving on to the State level.

Only the top 4 singers on each voice part qualify to move on to participate in the PMEA All-State Choir.

I am proud to report that all three of our singers placed well and Madeline Getola placed 4th in Alto 1 and WILL BE PERFORMING AS A MEMBER OF THE ALL-STATE CHOIR in the Poconos at the end of April!!

Please congratulate all of these singers on a job well done and for being such fine representatives of Troy!

Thank you!

Mrs. Sydney MacDonald

7-12 Choral Music Teacher ~ Director of Theater Arts

Troy Area Jr./Sr. High School

Apple Teacher

Community advisory bulletin

The high school administration has been notified of a threat written on a restroom wall at the high school for Friday 10/25. The writing appeared to be a cry for help and not a specific threat. All threats are taken seriously and investigated fully. Law enforcement was immediately notified and conducted an investigation with administration. This notification is part of our continuing effort to keep you informed. Please be aware that there will be additional law enforcement presence at TASD on Friday.



Please talk with your students about the seriousness of making any type of threat regarding school violence whether on or off school property. All threats regarding our schools will be taken seriously and may lead to significant disciplinary and legal action. We encourage parents and students to contact us with information, questions, or concerns. It is our primary duty to keep our students safe.

If any questions please call the Admin Bldg on 570 297 2750
